titleStmt.title: National Library of Sweden, A 200
titleStmt.sponsor: Medieval Latin Manuscripts in the National Library: Cataloguing and Digitization
titleStmt.funder: Riksbankens jubileumsfond – The Swedish Foundation for Humanities and Social Sciences

publicationStmt.publisher: manuscripta.se: A Digital Catalogue of Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts in Sweden

supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in pencil, 1-93. O caritas quam magnum

p.note: Top of page, in a contemporary hand: a few words, trimmed and illegible; top left corner, in pencil by a modern hand: A 200; centre page, in pencil by a modern hand: Liber Cartusiae Erfordiensis and a table of contents; bottom right corner: ; right margin, perpendicularly, in a contemporary hand: pen trials and some writing above, trimmed and illegible; bottom right corner, in ink by a modern hand, a note on the accession of the manuscript: Inköpt till Kgl. Bibliotheket från G. Stephens 23/10 1848; bottom of page, upside down in ink by a contemporary hand: pen trials, partially trimmed.

binding.p: Modern paper binding. , bottom left corner: National Library book label with the current signum.

origin.p: Germany Erfurt , 1414 and 1439?. The manuscript contains two colophons, one placing unit 1 in Erfurt, Germany, in (), and one dating unit 3 to (). The second colophon appears, however, to be a later addition. The hand has, furthermore, corrected the date from to -39. All three watermarks found in the respective units can be dated to 1408–15, matching the date of the first colophon, and all three are found in Rothenburg ob der Tauber

acquisition.p: Purchased from George Stephens in (see note on ).

msItem.title: Treatise on virtues and vices
msItem.incipit: PRius vicia exstirpenda sunt in homine deinde inserende virtutes
msItem.explicit: et trabem in oculo proprio nesciunt considerare etc et sic est finis

msItem.title: Commentary on Paeniteas cito (Paenitentiarius cum glossa et dubiis)
msItem.incipit: UAdam ad montem mirre (Cant. 4:6) Hec proposicio pro themate assumpta scribitur in canticis canticorum
msItem.explicit: et eterna vita per gloriam quam nobis concedat qui est benedictus in secula seculorum ameN
msItem.colophon: Et sic est finis huius libri scriptus et finitus erfordie Anno domini Mo cccco Xiiii feria quarta post dominica letare etc et sic est finis

msItem.title: Index of biblical verses
msItem.note: Alphabetical index of biblical verses with references.

watermark.term: Bull's head with eyes and single-outline rod and star extending above.

supportDesc.condition: The occasional stain or smudge (e.g. ). Edges trimmed with some loss of marginal annotations.

p.note:
The anonymous verse Ars mulierum, on the dangerous powers of women, in a contemporary cursive hand, printed by Lehmann (1936)
.
Minor corrections in a contemporary hand, possibly the scribe.
Upper left corner, a marginal notation in a contemporary hand, trimmed.
Biblical reference in a contemporary hand.

decoDesc.p: Main text in brown ink; rubrics in red; capitals touched in red; . : lemmata in display script over 2 lines framed and sometimes struck through in red (guidelines for the frames visible).

decoNote.p: : plain opening initial P over 4 lines in red with interior reserved shapes and flourishing in brown.
: plain initials over 2-3 lines in red, some with interior reserved shapes (e.g. ) and/or penwork (e.g. , ).
: puzzle initial U over 9 lines in red and brown with interior reserved shapes, penwork, and flourishing in brown.
: plain initial P over 8 lines, half in red and half outlined in red and filled in with penwork and flourishing in brown, and with tendrils in brown and red extending into the margin.
Bookmarks of leather in different colours on , , and .

msItem.title: Speculum amatorum mundi (Speculum humanae salvationis / Speculum peccatoris)
msItem.incipit: VIdete quomodo caute ambuletis (Eph. 5:15) Apostolus paulus Conscius consiliorum dei
msItem.explicit: fugiat ergo qui saluari desiderat ut penas eternas intollerabiles et horribiles declinet et evadat et regnum amenum et iocundum cum sanctis et electis eorum meritis et precibus possideat Quod nobis prestare dignetur qui patre et spiritu sancto regnat per infinita secula seculorum Amen

bibl.title: Doctoris extatici D. Dionysii Cartusiani Opera omnia

msItem.title: Regula vitae
msItem.incipit: Si vis esse perfectus in vita tua has regulas firmiter serua
msItem.explicit: sed pocius in exemplum time deum et sequere eum et sepe confitere Et cetera

note.p:
After the final rubric is added a paraphrase of Augustine, Augustinus Visus facit malam cogitacionem cogitacio delectacionem delectacio consensum consensus operam operacio consuetudo desperacionem despereacio eternam dampnacionem etc, a parallel of which can be found in Sermo 98, PL
.

msItem.title: Exhortations for a religious life
msItem.incipit: O tu religiosus homo tota intencione studeas ut habeas oculos stabiles
msItem.explicit: Quicquid agas prudenter agas et respice finem et cetera et est finis

watermark.term: Bull's head with eyes and single-outline rod and star extending above.

p.note: Biblical reference in a contemporary hand.

decoDesc.p: Main text in brown ink; capitals touched in red; opening line in display script over 2 lines, and, on , framed and struck through in red.

decoNote.p: : opening plain initial U over 5 lines in red with 2 interior reserved shapes, one of which filled in with brown.
: plain initial S over 6 lines in pale red.
: puzzle initial O over 7 lines in pale red and red.

msItem.title: Stella clericorum
msItem.incipit: Quasi stella matutina in medio nebule
msItem.explicit: et de salutari medicina sibi miserabiliter acquirunt eternam dampnacionem et sic est finis et cetera
msItem.note: The colophon is written in smaller script and in a different ink, and possibly by a different hand from the main text. Notable is also that a different decade (59) has been written first and then deleted.
msItem.colophon: Anno domini millesimo cccco lviiii xxxviiiio in vigilia beati bartholomei

msItem.title: On who is not be admitted into holy communion
msItem.incipit: Nota omnes hii subnotati propellendi sunt a communicacione sacra
msItem.explicit: Item omnes debita uolentes soluere et habentes Item

watermark.term: Bull's head with eyes and single-outline rod and star extending above.

p.note: Minor correction in a contemporary hand.
In the same contemporary hand, a quotation from Pseudo-Bernard's Meditations.

decoDesc.p: Main text in dark brown ink; rubric in display script written inside a red frame surrounding the opening initial.

decoNote.p: : opening plain initial Q in brown with interior reserved shapes and penwork in counter space and background.
: plain initials over 2 lines in red.
